events.message: The insured reported a collision involving their car on highway 45 resulting in visible damage to the front bumper.
After initial review, the claim was categorised under Auto Accident due to the vehicle collision and resulting damages.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to manage communications and oversee the claims process progression.
The claimant received formal acknowledgment of their accident claim with initial instructions on next steps.
The agent requested the police report, vehicle repair estimates, and photos of the damage to proceed with the investigation.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including accident report, repair bills, and photographic evidence.
Investigation commenced to verify cause of collision and assess the vehicle damage as per submitted documentation.
Investigation concluded confirming the insured’s liability and extent of damages aligning with submitted reports.
A settlement proposal was issued covering estimated repair costs and vehicle downtime compensation.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the settlement offer and appreciated the clarity in communication.
The claim was officially approved following agreement on settlement terms between insurer and claimant.
Payment corresponding to the approved settlement was transferred to the claimant’s designated account.
The claim was formally closed after successful payment issuance and confirmation of claimant’s acceptance.
All claim documents and related communications were archived in the system for record keeping and future reference.
